events.name: Cloud Study Jam - Docker & Kubernetes - Google Developer Group (GDG)
events.description:
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

We are running an introductory, hands on, workshop.

No prior knowledge of Google Cloud, Docker or Kubernetes required!

It's free to attend, with free access to Qwiklabs, the official Google training hands-on platform (a $55+ value). No need to register with a credit card.

Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs.

You will get hands-on experience with Kubernetes.

Earn Google Cloud badges to show your skills and expertise.

After our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home.

Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to complete any labs you want.

The session: https://blog.qwiklabs.com/study-jam-k8s1/

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)!

Don’t forget your charger.

Agenda

6:00 pm Welcome!
6:05 pm Get free access to Qwiklabs
6:10 pm Lab 1: Introduction to Docker
6:45 pm Lab 2: Hello Node Kubernetes
7:10 pm Lab 3: Orchestrating the Cloud with Kubernetes
7:30 pm Discussion & Demonstration
8:00 pm Event Ends
events.how_to_find_us:
We are at the Eagle Lab in Douglas 
Queen Victoria House, Victoria Street, Douglas, Isle of Man, IM1 2LF
(It's the old Manx Telecom building)

events.name: Google Next ’19 Extended Douglas & Cloud Study Jam -Google Developer Group (GDG)
events.description:
Next Extended brings together developer communities around the world to take part in the Next ’19 experience.
These events are extensions of Next - allowing local developers to access exciting Next ’19 content and engage with peers across the community through hands-on labs and speaker events.

This time we are covering Machine Learning.

Watching a stream from Cloud Next '19

Holding a hands on workshop

The session for the workshop: https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/32

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)!

Don’t forget your charger!

Agenda

6:00 pm Welcome!
6:05 Get free access to Qwiklabs
6:10 Lab 1: Introduction to APIs in Google
6:45 Lab 2: Entity & Sentiment Analysis with the Natural Language API
7:10 Watch one of the live streams together
7:40 Socialising
7:55 Swag random draw !
8:00 pm Event Ends
8:01 Celebrate together at a local hostelry
events.how_to_find_us:
We are at the Eagle Lab in Douglas 
Queen Victoria House, Victoria Street, Douglas, Isle of Man, IM1 2LF
(It's the old Manx Telecom building)

events.name: Introduction to databases: Learn PostgreSQL, SQL Server and Redis
events.description:
Join us for the next GDG Douglas event! It's a storage special, as we have invited three technical talents to each present on a different database solutions.

Nathan Pledger will be presenting on SQL Server, with Steve Burrows discussing PostgresSQL, and Christian Braybrooke introducing Redis. Join us for a beginner-friendly lesson on these fundamental foundations of modern software development.

After the talks we will be break for pizza and soft drinks, before jumping into data-storage focused Cloud Jam, provided by Google. In this tutored session we'll be walking through a Quiklab session that introduces working with database instances in the cloud. Don't forget your laptop and charger!
events.how_to_find_us: Opposite the Barclay's branch on the ground floor of Victoria House

events.name: Flutter Study Jam: An Introduction to Native App Development
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s portable UI kit for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter codelabs prepared by Google instructors.

This is an introductory demonstration to learn a newly-released app development technology.

This session will be best-suited for:
1) those interested in learning mobile app development
2) developers with experience on desktop/web platforms
3) seasoned iOS or Android mobile app developers new to Dart/Flutter

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine.

Check out : https://flutter.dev/docs/get-started/install

AGENDA:
6:00pm: Flutter Introduction
6:45pm: Break
7:00pm: Write Your First Flutter App, part 1
9:00pm: Event ends

Feel free to contact GDG Douglas organizers with any questions prior to the event. Otherwise, we look forward to seeing you there!

events.name: GDG Meetup - 27 August - Practical Machine Learning
events.description:
The Google Developer Group Douglas is back! Join us for an after-work meetup focusing on the industry hot topic of Machine Learning.

Our panel of local techies will be sharing their knowledge and experience of practical and approachable machine learning for all abilities.

Evening schedule:

1. Machine Learning and Reverse Image Search -- Carl Åsman
2. Creating models for iOS with Create ML -- Andrew Gleave
3. Natural Language Processing -- Toby Crayston
Workshop: Introduction to Machine Learning Qwiklab

Bring your laptop and charger to collaborate get hands on experience with Google Cloud ML services. Event hosts will be on hand to offer guidance as you learn the basic application and terminology when adopting. Attendees will earn one month of free education on Google's Qwiklab learning platform.

We'll be laying on some pizza between sessions, and sharing a post-event pint at Oscar's, so be sure to reserve your spot now!

events.name: GDG Meetup - 1 October 19 - Serverless DevOps on Google Cloud
events.description:
N.B. New venue - https://www.hubb.im

The Google Developer Group Douglas is back! Join us for an after-work meetup focusing on the Serverless Dev-ops on Google Cloud.

John will give a talk on building and deploying a Golang application following a 'push to master' on Google Cloud Run - a new beta service from Google Cloud that implements Cloud Knative.

Evening schedule:

1. Intro Google Cloud Build, Google Container Registry, & Google Cloud Run
2. A live edit and code deploy to a running service !
3. A qwiklab showing how to deploy docker applications on Google Cloud

Bring your laptop and charger to collaborate get hands on experience with Google Cloud services. Event hosts will be on hand to offer guidance as you learn the basic application and terminology when adopting. Attendees will earn one month of free education on Google's Qwiklab learning platform.

We'll be laying on some pizza between sessions, and sharing a post-event pint at Oscar's, so be sure to reserve your spot now!
events.how_to_find_us: We are opposite Oscars - there are light brown double doors, and our event will be on the second floor

events.name: Google Devfest 2019 - Douglas - Isle of Man
events.description:
NB - All Tickets now on sale at https://www.DevFest.im , please register directly on the www.DevFest.im website

22 & 23rd November

GDG DevFest is a large scale community-run event that can offer speaker sessions across Google product areas, workshops , codelabs and lightning talks.

We are delighted to welcome speakers from Google, Canonical, and the Google Developer Group, as well as other internationally renowned technologists.

We are powered by a shared belief that when developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen.

We are delighted that The Hubb are providing their fantastic venue in the heart of Douglas, for this first Devfest to be held in the Isle of Man.

Call for papers here : https://sessionize.com/google-devfest-2019-douglas - closing soon !

Devfest website : https://devfest.im

events.name: GDG Meetup - 11 December 2019 - Flutter Interact Viewing Party
events.description:
N.B. New venue - https://www.hubb.im

The Google Developer Group Douglas is back! Join us for an after-work meetup.

Join us for a Flutter Interact Viewing Party on Wednesday, December 11! Flutter Interact is an event about creation and collaboration with the world, broadcasted live from Brooklyn NY!

With viewing parties around the world, everyone can be a part of this interactive event that focuses on sharing ideas, experimenting and crafting beautiful experiences across devices.

We’ll showcase the latest from Google Design and Flutter, Google’s free and open source UI toolkit to build beautiful, natively compiled applications for mobile, web, and desktop - all from a single codebase!
events.how_to_find_us: We are opposite Oscars - there are light brown double doors, and our event will be on the second floor

events.name: GDG Meetup - 28 February 2020 - Get to know Cloud Firestore - Firebase Study Jam
events.description:
N.B. New venue - https://www.hubb.im

The Google Developer Group Douglas is back for its first event of 2020!

Join a community of like-minded developers and explore the latest Firebase for Web technologies as a team.

Get know Cloud Firestore

Complete this set of codelabs to understand Cloud Firestore. Explore first hand Cloud Firestore Queries, Security, Transactions and more.

Join us for our Firebase Study Jam! Together we'll work through Firebase for web codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Firebase…..
events.how_to_find_us: We are opposite Oscars - there are light brown double doors, and our event will be on the second floor
